subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Report Problem
msgSnippet: This helps a bit.  Is there anyway to embed the extra information, like description, in the Java file instead of a separate xml? Thanks, Shay ... -- ... hey,
messageBody:
This helps a bit. Is there anyway to embed the extra information, like
description, in the Java file instead of a separate xml?

Thanks,
Shay

Jan Cumps wrote:
> Shay,
>
> I've created a project on sourceforge for junit test
> reports containing test descriptions. Have a look at
> this example report, that shows description and
> diagrams for junit tests:
>
> http://junitpdfreport.sourceforge.net/examples/junit.pdf
>
> Regards, Jan
>
>
> --- gamerscloset <sthompso@...> wrote:
>
> > Hi, I'm trying to figure out how I could add extra
> > information to my
> > JUnit results. What I want is to have things like a
> > Description of
> > the test suite, which could be added to the JUnit
> > test via something
> > like a metadata tag. Then, when I run the tests and
> > generate the
> > results into an XML file, it would add that
> > description to the results
> > file.
> >
> >
> > Is this possible? I would like to add a few more
> > fields than that but
> > it's one example. I'd also like to not have to
> > create an
> > implementatin of TestCase since I already have
> > existing tests and
> > instead would just like to be able to add the new
> > information in some
> > way, such as a metadata tag.
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Shay
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
>
>
>
>
>
>
